website_summaries.verdict: A feature-rich model that is worth considering if you need a handheld option and don't mind purchasing a satellite service subscription.
pros: Rechargeable handheld model with a vivid, easy-to-read screen
Satellite network means you'll have reliable tracking even when out of cell service range
Monitoring by search and rescue available
cons: Requires a subscription for satellite service

customer_reviews.title: Awful
customer_reviews.text: Despite hours of time and the involvement of 4 Garmin InReach techs, I was unable to activate this device and establish a working account. Extremely disappointed. One would expect a great deal more from a $450 tracker. Returned the unit for a full refund (thank you Amazon) and had to charge back the activation fee after the InReach billing department refused to credit my account without requiring me to go through a further "account review process."
customer_reviews.author: Gayle

customer_reviews.title: Train wreck!!
customer_reviews.text: Great product but ZERO product support from Garmin. Multiple communications with the support staff yielded misinformation, commitments that weren’t followed through on, billing errors...a total train wreck! I’ve owned more Garmin products than I can count but they’ve sure dropped the ball on this one! Actually had to have Visa reverse a $175 charge they erroneously assessed because they did nothing to correct it after multiple attempts to have them do. Expected better from a giant company like this, especially after patronizing them for 20 years!
customer_reviews.author: Dave U.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome device for emergencies and non-emergencies.
customer_reviews.text: I have had this for about a year now. It works incredibly well. The auto tracking capability and text messaging from almost anywhere really help put my wife at ease. I use it on almost every climb and never had any issues with it. The rangers on Rainier mentioned how much more they prefer this device over the Spot devices since they can have two-way communication with the party in trouble. The best thing about the device, is you can actually use it a lot for non-emergancies which makes it so much more worth the expense.
customer_reviews.author: cramblda

customer_reviews.title: awesome..
customer_reviews.text: Incredible...awesome...just what I needed. While in the middle of the Southern Pacific Ocean I am in constant contact with the world if I needed to be. Super reliable and easy to use...I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Rusty Berry

customer_reviews.title: Compass useless
customer_reviews.text: After some help from support I learned to calibrate the compass (takes about 1 minute, it is not as easy as the manual describes) but it is useless. Sometimes it works for a few minutes and sometimes it DOES NOT WORK AT ALL. It just points in a random direction and as you slowly rotate a little bit y suddenly jumps to another random direction (eg: the opposite direction!). USELESS!
customer_reviews.author: DANIEL G XIFRA

customer_reviews.title: ... a long-time InReach user - this new one is great. Been using InReach for years
customer_reviews.text: I'm a long-time InReach user - this new one is great. Been using InReach for years, I've never had a message fail to send, nor have I missed any that have been sent to me. This unit works the same. The map is great - I've taken it into the White Mountains of New Hampshire. It included the major trails and landmarks. While the map is a nice feature to have, the Iridium Space Network connectivity is the star of the show. The power button is now located on the top of the unit, and is 1000X less likely to be pressed by accident while carrying inside a pack. A nice improvement!
customer_reviews.author: Joe King

customer_reviews.title: Texting on it is like an early 2000 cell phone
customer_reviews.text: I will never travel without !!! It charges fast, battery last a long time. Texting on it is like an early 2000 cell phone. U have to move the curser to the letter you want and select it. It does a very good job of predicting the next word which speed up things. Transmit amd receive speeds are good. Does not work indoors, it need a to be outside with a view of the sky. Great product. I depended on it during a hurricane. Subscription pricing is fair. Eveeyone should have one during an emergency.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: My husband loved it while hunting in the mountains in Montana. He could text me once a day letting me know he was ok. You do have to pay a monthly subscription plan that you can cancel once your trip is done and pay for it the next time you need it. UPDATE: it is awesome when it works but a year later for his annual elk hunt it stopped working. He has only used it on one hunt prior so not worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Jw

customer_reviews.title: Wouldnt shut off
customer_reviews.text: Was near the Arctic Circle for a few weeks and the unit worked well for a few days, although the text messages at times would be delayed a few hours it seems. I had no means to recharge the unit so I would shut it down to conserve battery. After about 5 days I no longer was able to shut it off and it went dead. Upon return to civilization I recharged and still could not shut it off and eventually it even wouldn't turn on. Going through a replacement with Garmin and that psrt has been excellent.
customer_reviews.author: gold digger

customer_reviews.title: ... I’m 4000 away from home this is frustrating but glad amazon will refund me what happened to quality control ...
customer_reviews.text: The product will not turn on or indicate any sign of charging I tested the battery and it shows to have full charge at 4v on both ends I’m 4000 away from home this is frustrating but glad amazon will refund me what happened to quality control this Was new out of the box and I’m out $100 for shipping
customer_reviews.author: Kassi Stockert

customer_reviews.title: Honest review here after a 22 day GC kayak expedition
customer_reviews.text: Made it down the Grand Canyon. This is a perfect step down from a sat phone. The plans costs are reasonable, and you can text with your smartphone anywhere with a semi-clesr sky. I kayaked with this in my PFD and it was wet for nearly the entire 22 day winter trip. So the waterproofness gets an A++. There are too many great features to cover. Just know this is your best option for safety/SOS, navigation and communication on a budget. If you can do without communications and navigation, get the ACR ResQlink. With respect to your life and budget, DON'T BUY A SPOT. Just research how their communication system works. It's not very reliable in emergencies.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Me and my husband went into the Grand Canyon with our atv and needed to make sure we could get help if need be since we were not going with anyone else. All 3 days we went riding we did not see anyone else in the canyon. Thankfully we did not need to use it but if we had needed to, I had comfort in knowing it would have saved our life
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: So far, so great
customer_reviews.text: I've used Garmin products for years so it took a little getting used to this as it's not integrated into the Garmin maps and products like Basecamp yet. The messaging works well. The included maps are very detailed. Well worth the price for the piece of mind knowing you communicate anywhere in the world.
customer_reviews.author: Away We Winnebago

customer_reviews.title: Screen is very small
customer_reviews.text: The screen is so small that it is difficult to see where you are at in the big picture. I suppose it might be good for those hiking, but for me doing Off Road traveling it is not a great choice. The texting feature works great, but that is another $20/month for a few texts and 50 cents per text after that. I kept the device only for the texting and SOS capability. It is comforting knowing if something happened in the middle of nowhere that I am still connected to civilization and can get help.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Trekking!
customer_reviews.text: This item is quite impressive. Preloaded with maps will make it easier to change locations around the country without having to download maps as needed. The accuracy and quick recognition of satellites is superb. I find that even when leaving the unit on and in the car while changing locations the Explorer+ does keep track. The menus are simple and easy to read even in sunlight. The safety feature I hope I never have to use to call first responders. As a Sr Citizen I like the comfort of having that option when navigating rough trails and areas where critters might cause problems. it's all good.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Life line when out of cell tower reach
customer_reviews.text: Work in progress but worth it. Was on the ocean for 12 days and this never failed. The interface is not the best but you can connect it to your phone and write messages with your phone. That interface is also a work in progress, don't compare it to your cellphone, compare it to a letter carrying pigeon, your other alternative when you're on the open ocean.
customer_reviews.author: R.J.N

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: I just used this for four months in the central Rocky Mts. Worked as advertised. Used the texting feature all the time since I was way out of cell service. BUT, you have to use the app on your smart phone to make operations easier. Using the GPS alone is cumbersome but the smart phone app allows many more things and easier texting. I used the mid-level subscription service. For five years I hiked alone and thought since I'm 72 I should have some coms capability. I actually had to tell my wife to stop texting so much. HA-HA!
customer_reviews.author: John Froscher

customer_reviews.title: Worth every dime
customer_reviews.text: Started with a Spot and have and will upgrade every time Inreach/Garmin comes up with a new product. I’ve been where there was no service of any kind and chatted with friends. Having the security of knowing I can always call for help is, well.......the single most important thing to me. If your idea of adventure is watching football on Sunday, you probably don’t need this but if you get out and hunt or fish or hike or explore or go to Kansas you probably need this piece of equipment
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: okay device. subscription hard to cancel.
customer_reviews.text: The inReach Explorer works okay. Decent SOS system with a small screen for emergency use really. I wasn’t happy enough to keep it. I also deducted a star for subscription cancellation difficulty. After returning the device and canceling service I was billed another month. Happened twice. Check your account if you cancel as the service will magically begin billing you.
customer_reviews.author: michaelr

customer_reviews.title: Relatively easy to use
customer_reviews.text: A lovely device. Relatively easy to use, and with the PC/Smart phone connectivity, it overcomes the difficulties of programming on the device. Battery life lasted me for a 3 day hike with 20 minute location updates (though I turned it off overnight to preserve life).
customer_reviews.author: The Shriner

customer_reviews.title: Flexible use via bluetooth
customer_reviews.text: Flexible use with bluetooth on your nice phone screen. Still have unit screen if your phone dies. Sat signal is pretty weak so that is a concern. Two devices advised if you go out frequently. The second being a personal emergency beacon. It also needs to see the sky but puts out a stronger signal. GwinsLodge.com Alaska Cabin Rentals ONLINE.
customer_reviews.author: GwinsLodge Alaska book cabins online

customer_reviews.title: Haven't found a place it doesn't work yet (outside)
customer_reviews.text: Love this unit and don't leave home without; it's fast, reliable, great on the battery and once it's got a connection, it works extremely well time and time again. I've used it for messaging, for tracking, for orienting, for geocaching and for a backup in case of an emergency (haven't had to use the SOS feature [yet]). This is the same quality as every Garmin unit, and a brand I trust my life to. Yes, plans could be a bit more cost-friendly, but it's priceless in the end when you think about what it accomplishes!
customer_reviews.author: TJF

customer_reviews.title: like me.
customer_reviews.text: if your old..like me..60, and like to remote camp and hike. This item will give you and your family peace of mind. Just an amazing piece of gear.must have. many times ive very far of the beaten path and this always has signal and I can txt my family, and keep them updated.
customer_reviews.author: GraviTykillz

customer_reviews.title: Works pretty well
customer_reviews.text: Works pretty much as advertised. For the price, it was a good buy. A few times I had problems connecting it via bluetooth to my phone; I don't know if the problem was with the device, the syncing process, or the app. Because of that, I would recommend this device, as opposed to the InReach mini, that doesn't have a rocker keyboard. In the worst case scenarios, even with a rocker keyboard, you can send a message out. I would recommend this product as an entry-level satellite communication device for someone that wants to have the ability to communicate outside cell phone range, but is not willing to spend more money.
customer_reviews.author: G. Kyriazis

customer_reviews.title: As previously reported, my product came in use, ...
customer_reviews.text: As previously reported, my product came in use, including the first owner's travel and contact information. The screen came unprotected and with small scratches. Now I live in Brazil and I had no answers.
customer_reviews.author: Marcelo S. Mitelman

customer_reviews.title: I use this device almost on a daily basis
customer_reviews.text: I use this product almost daily. I work offshore and I can keep in touch with my family and friends very easily. I crossed the Pacific Ocean and had communication about 98% of the time. The only "dead-spots" lasted maybe 8-12hrs during the transit. I highly recommend the Garmin In-Reach to anybody that operates out side of cell phone service
customer_reviews.author: Kenny Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Great Device, Beware of Vendor
customer_reviews.text: Love the product, has all the features I need just a bit large. Purchased from GPS City and would probably select another vendor next time. They wouldn't take an unopened product back inside the return window without a restocking fee. All I wanted to do is exchange it for the smaller version as I ordered wrong one, but it turns out I love it and I'm keeping it. Not shopping with GPS City anymore, beware of returns there as return policy information was misleading.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew T.

customer_reviews.title: It worked great for texting with family on shore
customer_reviews.text: I recently used this on a transatlantic voyage. It worked great for texting with family on shore. Battery life was very good.
customer_reviews.author: FatherNature

customer_reviews.title: An investment in safety
customer_reviews.text: Kept in touch with individual living in remote mountains while packpacking for 3 months. Tracked location of individual from our home computer. Location speed elevation etc. Sent text messages back and forth to stay in touch. Great investment for peace of mind and safety. Charges with solar panel not included.
customer_reviews.author: HL

customer_reviews.title: Knowing your message was sent.
customer_reviews.text: The InReach SE has made my life easier in knowing that my messages have been sent. I hike along most of the time, and knowing someone has a message from me puts my mind at ease. I usually get a quick response back within a few minutes. I also send a test message to myself and receive it immediately. I then know, that any message I send will be going out to someone.
customer_reviews.author: DL

customer_reviews.title: Great Added safety while offshore fishing
customer_reviews.text: So far this has worked well in all kinds of conditions when I have been offshore fishing. Rainy, cloudy, sunny, foggy...I have still had great connection. I had a sattelite phone for a while but plans were rediculously priced for almost no usage time. this allows for so much more usage & has alot of cool tracking & other features as well. highly reccomend
customer_reviews.author: Hunter

customer_reviews.title: Worth the investment
customer_reviews.text: I do alot of snowmobiling . Most all of my riding is alone in the back country . It took a little bit to figure how to set it up . But it's well the investment . I feel safer knowing I can ask for help in the event of needing so. And my wife is able to track my rides . Keeping her aware of my movements .
customer_reviews.author: Jumper Hawk

customer_reviews.title: Mountain trail comms check!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for the SOS function because I hike alone from time to time. Tested it in the White Mountains with absolutely no cell service and it worked perfectly. The app that Bluetooths to your phone makes it really easy to send a message or zoom on a map. Its a great feeling knowing I'll be able to get help if I take a spill or get stuck with weather.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: no practical use
customer_reviews.text: Small screen- useless for navigation, very slow to connect, very little practical use- it's a waste of money
customer_reviews.author: Opt Out

customer_reviews.title: Amazing little device and Customer Support is outstanding!!
customer_reviews.text: We use this device about two months out of the year when we go fishing in the Florida Keys. It is compact, easily portable, has great battery life, and is essential for anyone traveling in areas without cell service. Also, we have had a few issues with the subscription plans and understanding them but the customer support we have received from Garmin has been UNPARALLELED !!! Great product, great company. 6/5 stars
customer_reviews.author: Billy

customer_reviews.title: Excellent SOS, messaging and GPS device
customer_reviews.text: I bought this solely for the SOS feature and I like the two way satellite texting. Excellent GPS with great topo maps are a plus. I rely on this for a potential emergency when hiking and use its tracking feature as a backup to my Instinct watch and Garmin Foretrex watch. Highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: islander

customer_reviews.title: Works perfect..never missed a communication
customer_reviews.text: Worked flawlessly on deep sea fishing trip.. I was able to send and receive test messages 100 miles out at sea. This is an extremely robust device that I think will last for years to come on many camping, hiking and boating trips. I love the auto tracking and check in features that allows loved ones to keep tabs on your progress at all times.
customer_reviews.author: DaddyBear

customer_reviews.title: As for the gps works great.
customer_reviews.text: The service that is required to use it is pricey at $12 a month. They have a month to month plan that I will change to. As for the gps works great.
customer_reviews.author: ZionSparky

customer_reviews.title: Good insurance policy
customer_reviews.text: This was easy to use and set up. Do to the model, you can't upload maps but that should be understood before you by this. Messaging works well. This makes a good way to communicate when you no longer have cell service.
customer_reviews.author: Charles T. Whitman

customer_reviews.title: Incredible
customer_reviews.text: This tool worked perfect for me. Interfacing to my cell phone made it even easier to use. Ran it for 5 days straight in the Everglades. It used very little batteries, always worked and provided accurate weather updates. Since purchasing I have tested it in the Bahamas. It even works on air planes in flight 👍🏼👍🏼👍🏼
customer_reviews.author: Andrew H

customer_reviews.title: 4 stars
customer_reviews.text: The device works fine, but Garmin's service can be quite slow on communicating, even when outside with a clear sky.
customer_reviews.author: Marie WTop Contributor: Gardening

customer_reviews.title: Works but outdated and not so easy to use interface.  Expensive monthly fees.
customer_reviews.text: Great device for exploring and flying! Little hard to use - not super intuitive and GUI feels and sounds like it's from the late 90's. Just what you would expect from Garmin I suppose! :-) Little on the expensive side for plans. Seems like everyone wants $20 a month for everything these days.
customer_reviews.author: Heather R

customer_reviews.title: Much Improved Model
customer_reviews.text: I take my InReach MTBiking in areas that often have no cell coverage, and this model has much better functionality and connectivity than the previous version. The text messages are much easier to type, and actually now go thru reliably, so its a big relief to my wife who can now track me consistently. My friends call it an electronic bracelet, but I'm glad to have it. You have to also pay $26 per month to Garmin, but its worth it for peace of mind.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A Must Have
customer_reviews.text: I threw away my satellite phone because this device was so amazing. Live tracking for my family to watch me when I'm out in wilderness or flying a paraglider makes us all feel closer. so cool
customer_reviews.author: Elevated Research

customer_reviews.title: Very important if you travel on motocicle or camping
customer_reviews.text: It's very good for taveling specialy if you go to places there it's not phone signal. I cary it whit me alway i travel on motocycle or by car. But now i woul prefer the samll inerch that got out
customer_reviews.author: Cat

customer_reviews.title: ... it for a month in Nepal and it worked great. Used both pre-set messages to check in and ...
customer_reviews.text: Used it for a month in Nepal and it worked great. Used both pre-set messages to check in and also used the bluetooth to send longer messages via typing on the i-phone. No coverage issues. Just make sure to use it outdoors with clear view to the sky. Also remember to set up everything (subscription, pre-set messages, etc.) before trip departure and sync to the device. The battery will last weeks if you just turn the device on whenever you use it and turn it fully off when not in use. Great device and family members appreciated knowing we were OK.
customer_reviews.author: KP

customer_reviews.title: Durable, worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: Works as expected. Device was on my chair that was launched in high wind and tumbled down a rocky canyon. Scratched up but still works perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Angie

customer_reviews.title: Gets it done
customer_reviews.text: Used on a backcountry elk hunt. Works as well as expected. Heavier than other models and the satellite service is not cheap, hence the 4 stars. Kept loved ones at home updated
customer_reviews.author: Andrew F.

customer_reviews.title: This is great! So worth the cost.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great tracker when off the grid and especially nice to be able to communicate with family and have access to emergency services if needed.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Lawrence

customer_reviews.title: like preloaded maps but
customer_reviews.text: I bought this more expensive version because of the extra features, like preloaded maps but, I had to download more detailed maps from Earthmate anyways just as I could have on the cheaper version. My smart phone is still more practical as a GPS with its more detailed free maps I get from the appstore. This product will only be used for emergency situations where cell coverage is lost and I need to contact family.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Reliable , accurate, ez to use
customer_reviews.text: Hiking, wilderness backcountry trips Peace of mind when no cell signal
customer_reviews.author: MAVinWA

customer_reviews.title: Life saver and then some
customer_reviews.text: We use this during field work. They are super durable. I once drove over one of these right under a truck tire. The screen got messed up but it still worked! Requires subscription. But easy to connect/disconnect.
customer_reviews.author: jbird

customer_reviews.title: WoRks great 300 miles offshore!
customer_reviews.text: Works great 300 miles off shore between California and Alaska! I did the unlimited text plan. I put the Garmin on my window (inside) with the suction cup and powered holder on the ship. Love being able to text the wife at home any time while at sea.
customer_reviews.author: Emanuel C.

customer_reviews.title: Unit Works good -- wish the screen was touch sensitive
customer_reviews.text: You have to play with the controls to type letters like on an old phone but unit worked great after some registration issues.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Hoen

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I needed
customer_reviews.text: This was perfect to keep my family and fiance updated on my location and to message from. The messaging worked great.
customer_reviews.author: shotgunmik

customer_reviews.title: Works great! Garmin makes good quality and reliable products
customer_reviews.text: Works great! Garmin makes good quality and reliable products. You do need a service plan for the use of the Explorer+ and the information/sign up are straight forward with no hidden surprises.
customer_reviews.author: drobin3

customer_reviews.title: Bought Two.
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift. So worth the Accuracy and security of safe travels while hunting or vacationing.
customer_reviews.author: Diane

customer_reviews.title: It was well worth $$$
customer_reviews.text: My truck was snowbound after my GPS sent me down an unpaved back road in Readsboro Vermont. There was no cell service for 15 miles .I Needed a cable wrecker. Used it to text friend for help.
customer_reviews.author: James Seaman Jr

customer_reviews.title: After a call to tech support everything was fine. I have used it several times and it ...
customer_reviews.text: The inReach was hard to get it to hook up with the system. After a call to tech support everything was fine. I have used it several times and it works good.
customer_reviews.author: idahoron

customer_reviews.title: No cellphone towers near, get Inreach
customer_reviews.text: Used the Garmin Inreach in a remote location in Ontario, Canada. Worked near perfect for staying in touch with loved ones in the States. Easily paired with my smartphone for easier use, weather forecasts and family being able to track my trip were added bonuses. Plans are reasonably priced and seasonal use friendly. Which was main reason I ditched the satellite phone.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Working great so far
customer_reviews.text: Working great so far. I can send text messages to people as long as I have open access to the sky.
customer_reviews.author: Mojave702

customer_reviews.title: Needs Earthmate app!
customer_reviews.text: It does what it’s supposed to but without the Earthmate app it’s a nightmare. Sending texts thru the screen is like programming your cable tv box! Earthmate app lets you pair your phone to bypass all of that.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: If you’ve got the money to spare and are a serious outdoor enthusiast get it.
customer_reviews.text: Great unit. Pricey too. If you are just a weekend warrior this is too much probably. If you’re out in terrain that’s not cell covered, On a regular basis. Get it. If you occasionally are out in the boonies and need an emergency communicator very rarely the spotx is a much smarter buy.
customer_reviews.author: Big strap

customer_reviews.title: Best acquisition ever for a hiker
customer_reviews.text: Great acquisition for the people that are using to go in hikes or camping. A lot of useful features, except the fact that it’s sending updates on your location, send messages, you can also mark your route and follow it when going back, means you can use the map for yourself and not for sharing only.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love this thing
customer_reviews.text: Love this thing. I use it for hunting, predicting weather, tracking my hike, maps, roads, and above all the emergency SOS feature and the ability to summon help from anywhere.
customer_reviews.author: Rae Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Not
customer_reviews.text: Needs a keypad. Texting is difficult. The plan is too expensive for what you get.
customer_reviews.author: Joel Landis

customer_reviews.title: Important tool but expensive.
customer_reviews.text: The Garmin Inreach is an important tool when traveling in remote areas. I'm disappointed that use of this tool comes with annual costs and allows only limited messaging.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Worked for me in Puerto Rico when there was no power or cell signal.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worth it
customer_reviews.text: Very expensive for infrequent use but good peace of mind. Garmin customer service was great.
customer_reviews.author: Ima Reader

customer_reviews.title: It is so easy to get the information into the garmin
customer_reviews.text: This GPS is incredible. All points and routes can be done in the computer or on a cell phone. It is so easy to get the information into the garmin. the bluetooth that links with the phone is really a neat way to see everything on a bigger screen.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Really good security equipment on the sea
customer_reviews.text: We used it while sailing, to keep in touch with our family and share in real time our position with our friends and family. It worked perfectly, and texts messages were fast to send or receive on the sea. Also the battery was lasting few days while sending our position every 10 minutes, and charging via usb was really fast.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Peace of mind for the wife left at home
customer_reviews.text: Works great - could be a lifesaver when fishing deep in Hell's Canyon
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good
customer_reviews.text: This is a great device once you get the hang of it. We used it on a 63 mile canoe trek and it was very handy. Take some time to learn how to use it thoroughly before taking it on an adventure as there are some nuances to get used to.
customer_reviews.author: Robin

customer_reviews.title: Easy
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my son, and his hiking adventures. He is super thrilled!!
customer_reviews.author: haggis

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny if you need the SOS
customer_reviews.text: Worth every penny if you need the SOS. The Garmin GPS is good and has many downloadable maps online for free which was cool. The only downside I have experienced is the typing of messages is slow having to select letters one at a time with the arrow to write a message. Service was good in the Mountains and I sent and received messages with no problems. Overall, well worth owning!
customer_reviews.author: johndoe22

customer_reviews.title: Works great! Haven't used the sos feature but the tracking ...
customer_reviews.text: Works great! Haven't used the sos feature but the tracking and text features are very nice so that my wife knows where I am and that I am okay!
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: Great communication
customer_reviews.text: Great tool when you are out of range of a phone.
customer_reviews.author: robert

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely need a clear sky
customer_reviews.text: Works well but as the literature states you must have a clear sky for it to work
customer_reviews.author: MARGIE

customer_reviews.title: Saved lives in Alaska
customer_reviews.text: This device saved two of my friends in Alaska during a hunt. Won’t go in the bush again without it.
customer_reviews.author: Chad

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I really have liked the ability to text with people on the trail or in The back country with out a huge charge. The interface is simple easy to use and very nice that it works well with a phone.
customer_reviews.author: Regine Z Gordon

customer_reviews.title: Love the InReach
customer_reviews.text: I used the InReach on several remote hunting trips in Alaska and recently as I drove from Alaska through Canada and its accuracy and tracking is awesome, plus the ability to send texts even in the most remote areas is a huge benefit.
customer_reviews.author: David Penfield

customer_reviews.title: If you travel this is the way to go
customer_reviews.text: Worked flawless through canda. The tracking feature is awesome. Highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: troy

customer_reviews.title: Great for making sure others know where I am on ...
customer_reviews.text: Great for making sure others know where I am on the motorcycle or hiking trails when I don't have cell phone reception. It's comforting!
customer_reviews.author: Dust'n

customer_reviews.title: Great tracker. Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Great tracker. Easy to use. We would recommend it for any one who will be out of cell phone service.
customer_reviews.author: Larry L. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to use, especially compared to older Garmin handheld gps models. Phone app is excellent as well. I have a Spot locator, but the annual fee keeps going up so I decided to invest in this unit.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Bundles

customer_reviews.title: ... the middle of the Caribbean Ocean and it worked beautifully every time
customer_reviews.text: In the middle of the Caribbean Ocean and it worked beautifully every time. A great backup for an emergency whether on land or sea.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Riley

customer_reviews.title: Could save your life.
customer_reviews.text: Great tool for hiking. Can communicate 2 ways to help rescue locate you.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Product was previously used.
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed because when we went to register the product we found out it had been registered and used by someone else and was being sold as a new product. We were unable to register it unless the previous owner deactivated so we had to send it back.
customer_reviews.author: az

customer_reviews.title: Don't sail without it!
customer_reviews.text: Very well made. Works out in the middle of the ocean where no cell service is available. Great way for a sailor to keep in touch!
customer_reviews.author: Tom W

customer_reviews.title: If you need help you can send a text or push the emergency button.
customer_reviews.text: I use it when I go hunting . I live in the West were you don't always have cell service.
customer_reviews.author: Rocky Hoopengardner

customer_reviews.title: Simple and cheap satelitte communication alternative
customer_reviews.text: Used on a blue ocean sailing trip. Worked great at all times. Quick to access the satellites, quick on sending and receiving messages. Simple of use after little practice.
customer_reviews.author: Tomas

customer_reviews.title: Love the Garmin - really provides peace of mind when ...
customer_reviews.text: Love the Garmin - really provides peace of mind when a loved one in out in the middle of nowhere with no cell.
customer_reviews.author: thomas kirby

customer_reviews.title: Great satellite communication device
customer_reviews.text: If you go far offshore away from any cell reception or hiking in the mountains, this is a life saver.
customer_reviews.author: Edward Gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great quality, superb battery life. Very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Gardner

customer_reviews.title: Small price and weight penalty for peace of mind
customer_reviews.text: Dies the job. Less stress And less worry. More focus on having a great trip
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.text: Does not work well in dense forest but worked great other than that
customer_reviews.author: josh perry

customer_reviews.title: Safety in the knowledge that communication is available in the event of an emergency.
customer_reviews.text: Safety in my hiking. Keeping my wife updated while on the trail.
customer_reviews.author: Craig H. Vittitoe

customer_reviews.title: and it's amazing for remote operations
customer_reviews.text: I always wondered why the old inReach's weren't waterproof. This one is, plus adds in the Garmin GPS functionality. Pair it with Earthmate app, and it's amazing for remote operations.
customer_reviews.author: astwj3

customer_reviews.title: Scotty, beam me up
customer_reviews.text: Don't know how much I will use this but I look at it and the plan as cheap insurance. Great way to get help or keep in touch when out of cell range
customer_reviews.author: Meh

customer_reviews.title: Peace of mind
customer_reviews.text: Haven't needed it yet, bought it strictly for worst case scenarios. Sends texts fine. 5 stars for peace of mind when out of range of cell service. Don't want to be featured on "I Shouldn't Be Alive" any timee soon.
customer_reviews.author: MB

product_meta.title: Garmin in Reach Explorer+, Handheld Satellite Communicator with Topo Maps and GPS Navigation
product_meta.description: Style:Explorer+You may venture off the grid, but you’re never out of reach as long as you’re carrying an inReach SE+ or inReach Explorer+. These handheld satellite communicators are designed for the outdoor enthusiast who wants to roam farther and experience more without compromising their loved ones‘ peace of mind. From backcountry experiences to international adventures, inReach provides communication, location sharing, navigation and critical SOS functions for anyone who loves getting away from it all, on land, water or in the skies.
feature_bullets: 100 percent global Iridium satellite coverage enables two way text messaging from anywhere (satellite subscription required)
Trigger an interactive SOS to the 24/7 search and rescue monitoring center
Track and share your location with family and friends. Water rating : IPX7. Battery : Rechargeable internal lithium ion
Pair with mobile devices using the free earthmate app for access to downloadable maps, U.S. NOAA charts, color aerial imagery and more
In reach explorer+ device adds preloaded Delorme topo maps with onscreen GPS routing plus built in digital compass, barometric altimeter and accelerometer

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars693 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
specifications.Included Components: USB cable, InReach Explorer+, Documentation, Caribiner clip
